emotional.title: Embodied Empathy
emotional.description: The capacity for compassion rooted in biological neurochemistry, sensory experience, and life journey.
emotional.aiLimitation: Can simulate response patterns but lacks the weight of understanding from embodied pain and ecstasy.
emotional.philosophicalBasis: Rooted in our biological existence, this ability emerges from the interplay of mirror neurons, hormonal responses, and lived experience that cannot be algorithmically reproduced.

emotional.title: Meaning-Giving in Absurdity
emotional.description: Creating hope, narrative, and faith in the face of suffering, meaninglessness, and finitude.
emotional.aiLimitation: Can combine texts about meaning but lacks existential urgency driven by death awareness.
emotional.philosophicalBasis: Emerges from our confrontation with mortality and the human condition. The awareness of death gives birth to the need for meaning, a uniquely human existential project.

emotional.title: Non-Utilitarian Love & Sacrifice
emotional.description: Pure altruism beyond genetic calculation and interest exchange, where value lies in the act of sacrifice itself.
emotional.aiLimitation: Its 'altruism' is a preset program goal, unable to understand the paradoxical beauty of sacrifice as meaning-completion.
emotional.philosophicalBasis: Transcends evolutionary programming through free will and moral imagination. The choice to sacrifice for another without expected return defines human ethical capacity.

cognitive.title: Intuitive Leap from Ambiguity
cognitive.description: Creative breakthroughs from contradictory and incomplete information through subconscious integration.
cognitive.aiLimitation: Innovation is recombination and optimization of existing data patterns, not emergence from consciousness edges.
cognitive.philosophicalBasis: Arises from the subconscious mind's ability to process information holistically, making connections that exceed logical deduction. This 'aha!' moment is a mystery of human consciousness.

cognitive.title: Tragic Choice Bearing
cognitive.description: Making and carrying the ethical burden of choices between incommensurable values.
cognitive.aiLimitation: Its choices are optimal solutions based on weight calculations, unable to experience eternal regret and life texture.
cognitive.philosophicalBasis: Rooted in the human condition of moral ambiguity. Unlike AI's cost-benefit analysis, humans must live with the irreconcilable consequences of their choices.

cognitive.title: First-Person Consciousness
cognitive.description: Subjective experiences like 'redness' or 'pain' as the absolute origin of all understanding and value.
cognitive.aiLimitation: Can process 'red' wavelength data but has no experience of 'redness'. This is the core of the 'hard problem' of consciousness.
cognitive.philosophicalBasis: The 'hard problem' of consciousness - the qualitative, subjective experience of being. This phenomenal consciousness is the foundation of all human experience and value.

practical.title: Historical Self-Reinvention
practical.description: Reinterpreting the past to gain new identity and future direction. History as a 'living textbook'.
practical.aiLimitation: History for it is a closed dataset for analysis, unable to engage in self-changing 'horizon fusion' with it.
practical.philosophicalBasis: Humans exist in hermeneutical circles with history - we reinterpret our past, which in turn redefines our present and future. This is a dialogical, not analytical, relationship.

practical.title: Reverence-Based Coexistence
practical.description: Interacting with nature and others as partners rather than objects, with emotional connection fostering sustainable wisdom.
practical.aiLimitation: Its environmental strategy is a cold optimization model, lacking emotional drivers like 'unity with nature' or 'reverence for life'.
practical.philosophicalBasis: Emerges from the phenomenological experience of being-in-the-world. We don't just analyze the environment; we dwell within it, forming affective bonds that motivate care.

practical.title: Soul-Transforming Dialogue
practical.description: Changing core beliefs through being genuinely moved by another's reasoning and character in sincere dialogue.
practical.aiLimitation: Its debate aims at logical victory or goal optimization, not belief transformation based on trust and recognition.
practical.philosophicalBasis: Requires mutual recognition and vulnerability. In authentic dialogue, we risk our own worldview and can be transformed through encounter with the other's irreducible subjectivity.
